image.altText: Anthony Albanese at Garma Festival

props.synopsis: The federal government is promising $842.6 million over six years for remote Aboriginal communities in the Northern Territory, including for essential services such as policing, women's safety and alcohol harm reduction.

props.synopsis: Positive signs around falling inflation are balanced against increased uncertainty, which threatens to weigh on household consumption and business investment.

title.children: Signs point to inflation falling but jump in unemployment 'cannot be ruled out'

image.altText: Two app icons on a black screen.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's last trade war with China allowed Shein and Temu to become e-commerce giants during a cost-of-living crisis. But his latest tariffs will not hurt the companies as much as those who rely on them.

title.children: Trump's tariffs on China are a 'double-whammy' for Temu and Shein

title.children: Trump's Gaza proposal surprised many, but we've seen this tactic before

image.altText: People coming off a train

title.children: Rail union threatens new work bans to 'escalate' Sydney train disruptions

image.altText: Mitchell Starc celebrates a wicket

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc wastes little time getting stuck into Sri Lanka's tail after Australia opts to take the second new ball late on day two.

title.children: Starc's late double strike ensures Australia ends day one on top

image.altText: A CIA emblem on the floor of a building.

image.altText: Three people holding signs with marshmallows saying 'burnt out' and 'reform now'

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in NSW are threatening to walk off the job after the circulation of an email written by an HR officer who likened them to confectionery.

title.children: Leaked email from HR calling doctors 'marshmallows' sparks fury

image.altText: A lawyer dressed for a court and a woman in a suit arrive at the Federal Court.

title.children: ABC boss asked if the Lebanese race exists in Lattouf case

image.altText: Joe Schmidt looks behind him

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A smiling mother with her newborn girl.

props.synopsis: Amid the tragedy and destruction in flood-ravaged North Queensland there has also been joy.

title.children: Hospital a 'beacon of light' as mum gives birth in flood-ravaged town

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair smiling pointing to her black t shirt which says "say something"

props.synopsis: Former Queensland Australian of the Year Rachel Downie is suing Rockhampton Grammar School for at least $5 million in compensation, arguing it failed to appropriately address her reporting of the abuse.

title.children: Child protection advocate sues elite private school over alleged abuse in 1980s

image.altText: A close up of a bearded man with shaggy dark hair and a black blazer tilts his head to the left as he listens

title.children: Streets in lockdown after man shot with homemade gun on Gold Coast

image.altText: Jakara Anthony and Val Guseli pose

title.children: How Australia's top medal hopes shape up a year out from the Winter Olympics

image.altText: Cooper Burns is congratulated

title.children: Kookaburras' post-Paris rebuild continues with win over Dutch champions

image.altText: A family poses for a photo in front of a temple in Indonesia

title.children: Indonesian family's Australian residency approved after ABC inquiries

title.children: On patrol with the NT's school enforcers as parents face $370 fines

image.altText: Sarah Shams in a bright pink skirt

props.synopsis: As a double above-knee amputee, I've had a complicated relationship with fashion over the years.

title.children: My clothing makes me feel fierce: The joy of dressing for myself

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: The typical way the so-called "Bank of Mum and Dad" is used appears to be shifting, according to new figures that show most of the cash passed from parents to children is being used on living expenses, rather than a home deposit.

title.children: Is helping their adult children 'the price baby boomers are paying'?

image.altText: a plume of smoke arises from a bushfire

props.synopsis: As Tasmania battles more than a dozen fires sparked by a band of dry lightning strikes, some in high-value wilderness areas, researchers are raising the possibility that this is the 'new normal'.

title.children: Tasmania's wilderness areas at increasing risk of fire, researchers say

image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader said Trump was a "big thinker and a deal maker" with a "genuine desire to see peace and stability".

title.children: Dutton praises 'shrewd' and 'reasonable' Trump after Gaza comments

image.altText: Kaitlyn Dever recreates Belle Gibson's infamous 60 Minutes interview, with a ponytail and pink jumper.

title.children: New series tells the story of Belle Gibson, the influencer who scammed Australia

image.altText: An old weatherboard building with sand dunes falling away, rubbish on the beach

props.synopsis: A Queensland council will put an asbestos-riddled former surf life saving clubhouse out of its misery after erosion put it at risk of falling into the sea.

title.children: Beachfront 'eyesore' to be demolished after erosion exposes foundations

image.altText: Tyler Wright surfs

props.synopsis: Australian surfers Tyler Wright, Isabella Nichols and Molly Picklum have reached the quarter-finals as the Pipe Pro resumed in Hawaii after a week of delays.

title.children: Surfing resumes at Pipe Pro in Hawaii as three Aussies make quarterfinals

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Laos has failed to accept "consistent" offers by Australian Federal Police to assist the investigation into the methanol poisoning deaths of Australian teenagers Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles.

title.children: Laos has not accepted AFP offers to aid methanol poisoning investigation
